body: To the Editor Your article on Manhattan Beach on Sept. 16 states that the "biggest problem is popularity with outsiders [ my emphasis ] in the summer. To ease congestion streets are off-limits to parking . . . ." This situation has always infuriated me. Look at the abutting Brighton Beach area if you need a definition of "congestion" -- summer and
title: Manhattan Beach

body: Stephanie Claire Epstein, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Stanley Epstein of Brooklyn, was married last evening to Peter Alan Reiner, a son of Martha Reiner of Englewood Cliffs, N.J., and the late Charles Reiner. Rabbi David S. Halpern oficiated at Temple Beth El of Manhattan Beach in Brooklyn. Mrs. Reiner, 27 years old, graduated summa cum laude from
title: Stephanie Claire Epstein Wed to Peter Alan Reiner

body: LEAD: May link recalls her first trolley rides to Manhattan Beach with her mother in 1912. For five cents, they took hour-long trips from working-class Williamsburg to the Brooklyn enclave of millionaires' mansions. body: LEAD: CELIANE LEVY, a daughter of Paulette Levy of Kew Gardens, Queens, and the late Samuel Levy, was married last evening to JAY E. REINER, the son of Marilyn Reiner of Belmont, Calif., and Richard Reiner of Fresh Meadows, Queens. Rabbi Asher Murciano officiated at Temple Beth-El of Manhattan Beach in Brooklyn. title: Celiane Levy Is Wed

title: Mireet Greenspan Weds in Brooklyn

body: LEAD: A 30-minute power failure affected 6,000 customers yesterday in the Sheepshead Bay section of Brooklyn. A spokesman for Consolidated Edison, Martin Gitten, said a 27,000-volt line malfunctioned at noon, cutting off power from Avenue U to Manhattan Beach and from Brigham Street to Shell Road. The power failure was not related to the weather,
title: Power Failure in Brooklyn

body: LEAD: A police officer eating lunch in the back room of a midtown jewelry store shot and critically wounded one of about eight men who tried to rob the store yesterday, the police said. A police officer eating lunch in the back room of a midtown jewelry store shot and critically wounded one of about eight men who tried to rob the store yesterday,
title: Suspect Shot in Robbery Attempt at Jewelry Store

body: LEAD: Samuel G. Domash, a retired businessman and philanthropist, died of complications of diabetes on Tuesday at Brookdale Hospital in Brooklyn. He was 89 years old and lived in the Manhattan Beach section of Brooklyn. Samuel G. Domash, a retired businessman and philanthropist, died of complications of diabetes on Tuesday at Brookdale Hospital in
title: Samuel G. Domash, Executive, 89

body: LEAD: Karen Sue Temes, a nurse in neonatal intensive care at Brigham and Women's Hospital in Boston, and Dr. Lewis Milrod, a fellow in behavioral neurology at Children's Hospital there, plan to marry in May. title: Karen S. Temes, Nurse, to Marry
